pageProduct.name: Telfast 180mg 70 Tablets - Antihistamine for Hayfever Allergy Relief
pageProduct.description:
Â 

Information

Telfast 180mg is a fast-acting treatment providing hayfever allergy relief within one hour and lasts for up to 24 hours.

It contains an antihistamine called fexofenadine hydrochloride which helps reduce common hayfever symptoms such as runny nose, sneezing, itchy eyes, itchy throat and itchy skin rash (hives).

The non-drowsy formula means your day can go on uninterrupted.

Consider using Telfast 180mg with Telnasal Allergy Spray. Telnasal may be used for up to six months to help prevent the onset of hayfever symptoms in adults and children aged 12 years and older.

Seasonal allergic rhinitis and hives

Seasonal allergic rhinitis, or hayfever, is caused by an allergy to pollen from grasses, flowers, or trees. It can cause sudden, frequent attacks of sneezing, nasal discharge and congestion. These episodes may also be accompanied by eye symptoms, such as stinging, watering eyes and itchy eyes. While it typically develops in childhood, it is not unusual to develop hayfever as an adult. The average age to develop seasonal allergic rhinitis is 15 years.1

Hives (otherwise known as Urticaria) are characterised by circular red, raised and itchy welts on the surface of the skin. They may look like mosquito bites, with a red outer rim and a white centre. They cause a rash, which may occur anywhere on the body, but is most commonly found on the torso, throat, arms and legs. Welts may vary in size from relatively small to the size of a dinner plate. Individual hives usually disappear within minutes, however they may come and go for days, weeks or sometimes longer.2

The Australasian Society of Clinical Immunology and Allergy (ASCIA) estimates that up to 20% of Australians will develop hives over their lifetime.2
